sn7.6:0.3: 6. With Bhāradvāja of the Matted Hair
sn7.6:1.2: Then the brahmin Bhāradvāja of the Matted Hair went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
sn7.6:1.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn7.6:1.4: and addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn7.6:2.2: these people are tangled up in matted hair.
sn7.6:2.4: who can untangle this tangled mass?”
sn7.6:4.1: Those in whom greed, hate, and ignorance
sn7.6:4.3: the perfected ones with defilements ended—
sn7.6:5.3: and impingement and perception of form:
sn7.6:5.4: it’s there that the tangle is cut.”
sn7.6:6.1: When he had spoken, Bhāradvāja of the Matted Hair said to the Buddha,
sn7.6:6.3: And Venerable Bhāradvāja became one of the perfected.
